abstract: A Milan judge has ordered four banks, Morgan Stanley, Deutsche Bank, UBS and Citigroup, to stand trial in connection with the 2003 bankruptcy of the Italian dairy company Parmalat, the banks said. Judge Cesare Tacconi set the date for Jan. 22, the four firms confirmed Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: A Milan judge has ordered four banks, Morgan Stanley, Deutsche Bank, UBS and Citigroup, to stand trial in connection with the 2003 bankruptcy of the Italian dairy company Parmalat, the banks said. Judge Cesare Tacconi set the date for Jan. 22, the four firms confirmed Wednesday.

headline.main: Four Banks Ordered to Stand Trial in Parmalat Case
